tweet: World Rugby really needs to do something genuine around growing the game in new nations, or have an eight-team #WorldCup with serious qualifying. Forty games over the course of a month to whittle nine teams down to eight as it stands, and almost exclusively foregone conclusions.
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Are people who talk about this being best World Cup ever suffering from recency bias? One entire half of knock-out stage was really poor. For me there were three elite games all tournament. Wasn't a bad competition at all, but don't get how it was better than others. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: While France strange the life out of this, here's my unbalanced team of the tournament. 3-5-2. Lloris; Umtiti, Varane, Godin; Perisic, De Bruyne, Modric, Kante, Trippier; Hazard, M'bappe. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Brazilian TV with their massive staff in Russia pick team of tournament. No sign of literally best player of World Cup Varane. Instead Miranda at centre half. People don't believe me when I say most here don't have a notion about football after all the machismo. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Been a real joy and entertainment to Belgium this World Cup. Second best team but by a distance the most fun. #bel #WorldCup2018
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On @lstwrd now talking World Cup final. #Cro #Fra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: The World Cup third place play-off is as cruel as pointless. Be like walking on on your other half cheating and being told you can make the bed when they are done. #eng #bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Croatia the story though. People talked about Iceland getting to tournament with 334,000 people, try getting to final with 4.2m. Completely deserved too. What a country. Unprecedented in modern era.   #eng #cro #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Very average team finally fall when running into first decent team they've played all tournament. Glad they gave England serious fun in recent weeks but from analysis point-of-view, full of okay players, didn't overachieve, got that far only via luck of draw. #eng #cro #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Ivan Perisic determined to beat England single-handedly. Getting close too. Been best player on pitch. #Cro #Eng #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Croatia are tired but England have done very little after perfect start to kill this off when it was there for killing. Sterling been superb but those behind him? Alli okay, Young not good, Lingard out of depth... #eng #cro #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Well, it's cultural at least. Tranmere showing England game. Warming up with a bit of Jeremy Kyle. #eng #cro #WorldCup  https://t.co/AHnIU43rS3
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On @lstwrd with @cooper_m at 18.15 looking back, looking forward, looking up, but never looking down. #WorldCup #Bel #Fra #Eng #Cro
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Heading into a final, Raphael Varane is my player of the tournament, followed by Mbappe and Hazard. That is all. #Fra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Just watched back the semi-final for my sins. France, technically sublime but man are they boring. They'll crush England 1-0 in final. #fra #bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Said on @lstwrd before kick-off that Belgium need to improve hugely at set pieces, but more generally what has been up with defending against dead-ball crosses all tournament. In a game of this particular standard, to concede like that is soul destroying. #Fra #Bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Outside of Messi, and when on game, there's not a more exciting and enjoyable footballer to watch than Hazard. Balance is outrageous. #Bel #Fra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Really hope Belgium win. Team that tries to think outside box against a solid structure that tries to keep everyone in the box. #Bel #Fra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Champions League Final - Belgium-France Europa League Final - Croatia-England #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Who'd have thought coming into this tournament that Russia would be missed. Really proper team bringing excitement, entertainment, great atmospheres unlike so many other games. Hope it helps football boom there. #Rus #Cro #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Just thinking, if Russia win this who will have been the best midfielder and who will have been the best striker England would have faced on the way to a final? Real Germany 2002 feel about it. #Rus #Cro #eng #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Say what you like about the team or the country, but Russia have an anthem that makes even the hairs on your arms stand to attention. #Rus #Cro #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Can people stop saying a game is 50-50 because it's a final, and that it's a one-off game. Literally ever game ever has been a one-off game and that doesn't mean a better team are suddenly not better. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Fair play England, credit where it's due, can only beat what's in front etc. Shocking defending from a side that should be embarrassed, via gently floated cross. Game has actually sucked the energy out of me to even cheer against them. Basically boring. Pity. #eng #swe #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: For all my complaints about Brazil, when you see that team out and then look at today... Way the draw worked out is a sporting travesty. Five really bad games in the bottom half, two more to come, and then whoever emerges making the final a foregone conclusion #eng #Swe #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: This is surely part of some great Swedish plan. While they put the planet to sleep with their football, they must have invaded Norway or something. #Swe #Eng #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: This is like looking at two puppies thrown into a river. #Eng #Swe #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Kind of sad now! After all that... #Bra #Bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Douglas Costa been really good every time he came on, changes it up for Brazil. Tite too loyal, as shown by Gabriel Jesus. Hazard absolutely immense though. The selfless workload huge. Bloody good game. Brilliant in fact. Loved it. #Bel #Bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Martinez really going all or nothing in normal time with these subs. If Brazil score, extra-time could be a bloodbath. #Bra #Bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Savage by Coutinho, exactly like the ball against Serbia for the goal. Serious vision an execution. Game on? #Bra #bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Brazil, out of ideas, revert to cheating. Although Juninho Pernambucano has already said this tournament it's in their DNA as if a good thing, and it's a skill. That's the culture of always excusing and never improving that holds them back. #Bra #Bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Marcelo wouldn't be much into the old defending. A renegade against his actual position and role. #bra #bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Said all along when pressure comes against a good team, Brazil will melt. Now let's see if I was wrong. Goal from set piece but in trouble in open play too. #Bel #Bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: I am genuinely giddy about this game. Have been since the draw. If Brazil all click that's it. If Belgium don't all hit full tilt that's it. And still a part of me thinks the underdog's could catch them out and knock them out on the break. #Bra #Bel #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On the @lstwrd with @cooper_m at 18.15 talking about France's warning shot, the game I've been giddy about since the draw, and how tomorrow is a chance to go out and get some fresh air. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Very German from the French. Not as entertaining but more impressive than last day. Capable of different, more mind blowing football, but what we saw tends to be football of the winners. #Fra #Uru #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Pretty much every time this World Cup I've moaned about a game being boring, it's taken off. Therefore I am desperately moaning here as my eyes are quite liteally closing. If the crowd takes it up a notch a funeral might break out. #Fra #Uru #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Very safe to say two semi-finals on Friday. What a dire advert for football. Geiger needs to go back to the MLS. As for the teams, like two broke lads fighting over a meagre bill neither can afford to start with. Five Colombians in book and Maguire still not? #ENG #COL #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: There's 45 minutes we can never get back. The dog was right. Wanted the walk at kick off. Would've been much more rewarding. #eng #col #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Some start by Kieran Trippier. Frantic pressing all over. Manic. What happens when that settles down... #eng #col #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Not saying it would be acceptable but Brazil players genuinely put their tournament at risk with some of their antics. If a team is going out, after enduring their shamelessness, someone is eventually going to get full value for a red card. #bra #mex #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Brazil are so exposed against quick counter. Might not finish them here but it will soon. Lacking control too, like a better boxer getting dragged into a brawl. Glad we got the Mexico of first and not last day. Loads of energy. #Bra #Mex #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Also as Messi likely exits World Cup stage, how many more will we be talking about Kylian Mbappe in. That was outrageous. Exciting every time ball went his way.#Fra #Arg #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Second time Ottamendi has done that this tournament. Don't say this lightly but he is worse than a bad loser, he is a thug. Just for him, even with Argentina making it a brilliant game, glad they are gone. #Arg #Fra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: More like it. You just couldn't have a Mercado that isn't even as good as the Tuesday morning effort in Athy, combine with a nightclub bouncer turned football manager who clearly has leopard-print bed-sheets, to put out this France. #Fra #Arg #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Said it in groups that France game-to-game slowly waking up. Very good here but just look at that team, if they hit close to top gear in latter stages there's not a team in this that will beat them. Incredible talent all over. #Fra #Arg #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On @lstwrd in five talking England's losing the plot and France's time to shine. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: England's arrogance will have done them in here if they lose. Japan and a World Cup quarter-final there for the taking, with a free if hopeless shot at Brazil to end a good tournament. Got greedy though. Colombia will beat them methinks. #eng #bel #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: if and when Brazil use this system against a good team (quarter-final onwards) they will be torn open on breaks and turnovers. Too much attack minded in middle with Silva and Miranda left to weather an onslaught. #Bra #srb #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On @lstwrd in five minutes, talking Germany's dire and dismal exit and tournament, Brazil's potential and potential stumbling block. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Remember in 2014 Jogi Loew's cold and unfitting first words in press conference after final were "this is the natural end of a process".   This stale and predictable effort feels like the same process four years after he was supposed to start a new one. #Ger #Kor #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Der Mannschaft goes limp. #ger #kor #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: On @lstwrd in a couple of minutes talking the chaos and fun of last night around VAR and the bigger picture around it. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: If this sounds elitist, it's because it is. As a World Cup is supposed to be. But when a group of the level of this Panama can qualify, the allocation to their region needs to be looked at. It doesn't grow game either, just humiliates a nation. Waste of everyone's time #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Did Panama go on the lash last night, have a massive row with their wives when falling in the door at 4am, woke to a 9am call about how they'd just been let go from their day jobs, had a quick vomit and cry, before shacking up at this without time for lunch? #pan #eng #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: This Brazil team is being set up for another 2014. Maybe not seven but Tite thinks this system works, Neymar thinks his attitude works; same blame game and zero ownership or responsibility followed by hysteria for doing nothing worthwhile. All as four years ago. #Bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Has Neymar passed the ball in that half? Gets possession and sequence in his head has to end with him scoring or winning free. In reality it ends with him diving. As I've said for months, this TEAM is better without their best player. That is terribly telling. #Bra #Crc #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Brazil's attitude around the box sums them up. No constructive play, no patience, no looking for the opening. And why would there be when someone can just take a shot and maybe get a goal for themselves. Set up means best will eat them alive on counter too. #bra #crc #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Told the CBF are to write a letter of complaint to Fifa (again), furious Costa Rica didn't roll over in the first 20 minutes at the instant sight of their reputation and glory and manhood. #Bra #Crc #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Pop goes that balloon. A lot of talk, macho nonsense, egos, misdirected emotion, and a whole bunch of players that can't get near a big league. No surprise at all. #cro #arg #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Messi? Ronaldo? On @lstwrd in a moment. #WorldCup #Arg #Por
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: France in opener like a lad who woke way too early on a Saturday. This is him after a mid-morning coffee. Bodes well, even if I wouldn't place much faith in Deschamps. That much talent can take over come the evening. #fra #per #worldcup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Loving today's #WorldCup. #Per really good last day but on brink; if #Fra must be moody, wanting to see if it can be passion with some intent; #Cro beginning to enter that category with Belgium as dark horse for last four; #Arg a mess, can Messi delay his end on this stage?
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Senegal, Mexico, Japan and Iceland for the semi-finals. Calling it here and now. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Some not-so-light reading before Russia re-emerge.  The other story of this #WorldCup featuring Putin's soft-power play, mafia money laundering, dodgy art work, German gas needs, Ukrainian sovereignty and a guest appearance from Kim Jung-un. (€) #rus #egy  https://t.co/NTUNXTYLkm
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Ahead of England later, column via @IndoSport. This time they'll give us one more reason to joyously point and laugh, but take it in as a serious change is coming. #eng #worldcup  https://t.co/GM3B3h1fc9
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Never got as much abuse here as last month when I said Brasil team better without Neymar. All the online football nerds showing stats and more stats. Not a peep today. Go watch Kardashian's, sport not your thing. #bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: That's the sort of result that will leave the German's logical, rational and largely emotionless. #Ger #mex #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Just been told a fascinating and remarkable story from very good source about why Leroy Sane wasn't picked for Germany squad... #Ger #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: The amount of people in Brazil in recent days conflicted about wearing yellow shirt today is huge. Colours were assumed by the right in overthrowing socialist government and Selecao seen by many as the national team of that wealthy part of society, not their part. #bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Argentina cannot stop whining. Free in last seconds, best waste time moaning to the referee as you believe the ball should be eight inches closer to the goal. Thrilled for Iceland. Not just an underdog, play good football too. And not just making up numbers. #isl #arg #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: There's more contact in volleyball these days. A fart would blow most of the Argentinians down. Justice done via an awful penalty. #arg #isl #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Ten minute segment on Brazil's main TV station ahead of Selecao game tomorrow, about how not to explode yourself and friends, and how not to set yourself on fire when lighting a barbeque.   I'd be thinking natural selection around this. #bra #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Just looked back at that Portugal break at 1-0 where Ronaldo, in a shoulders back light jog at 33, sped past everyone in the field who were in all out sprints. Left them for dead. Unbelievable. #por #esp #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: The speed of Cristiano Ronaldo's stepover to win that penalty... Reminded me of Floyd Mayweather's hands. Simply incredible. #por #ESP #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Somewhere - in a galaxy far, far away-  I know for a fact @jonawils has been sitting steamy and aroused by the tactical set-ups and intriguing chess battles of the day thus far. #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Amazing and wonderful the illogical, nonsensical emotions a #WorldCup throws up. Sitting here feeling gutted for Egypt due to a Uruguay goal. And especially gutted or this guy.  https://t.co/0rDxJ6tFCx #egy #uru
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Irony of Saudi Arabia is a nation that bans alcohol put together a pub team... Can't help thinking if that's the sort of dross that powers into a 32-team field, imagine level when it expands to 48. There'll be lads playing in denim shorts with beer bellies. #ksa #rus #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: This is like some football version of Death Race. Losing coach shall be beheaded due to a gentleman's bet by their leaders. #rus #KSA #WorldCup
name: Ewan MacKenna

tweet: Best draw possible. In terms of opposition and order. Still have Ireland outsiders, but best chance now before them. #Denmark #WorldCup2018
